i.name: Happy Hour
i.description: On ability use, Gragas takes a drink restoring 6% of his max Health. This effect can only happen every 8 seconds.

q.name: Barrel Roll
q.description: Gragas rolls his cask to a location, which can be activated to explode or will explode on its own after 4 seconds. Enemies struck by the blast have their Movement Speed slowed.

w.name: Drunken Rage
w.description: Gragas guzzles down brew from his cask for 1 second. After finishing, he becomes drunkenly empowered, dealing magic damage to all nearby enemies on his next basic attack and reducing damage received.

e.name: Body Slam
e.description: Gragas charges to a location and collides with the first enemy unit he comes across, dealing damage to all nearby enemy units and stunning them.

r.name: Explosive Cask
r.description: Gragas hurls his cask to a location, dealing damage and knocking back enemies caught in the blast radius.

riot.name: Happy Hour
riot.description: On ability use, Gragas takes a drink restoring 6% of his max Health. This effect can only happen every 8 seconds.

i1.name: Happy Hour
i1.blurb: On ability use, Gragas takes a drink restoring 6% of his max Health. This effect can only happen every 8 seconds.
i1.description: {{sbc|Innate:}} '''Gragas''' {{tip|heals}} for {{as|{{sti|health|6% '''maximum''' health}}}} upon using an [[Champion ability|ability]].

riot.name: Barrel Roll
riot.description: Gragas rolls his cask to a location, which can be activated to explode or will explode on its own after 4 seconds. Enemies struck by the blast have their Movement Speed slowed.
riot.tooltip:
Gragas rolls his cask to a location. When reactivated, or after {{ e4 }} seconds, the cask will explode, dealing {{ e1 }} (+{{ a1 }}) magic damage to nearby enemies and slowing their movement speed by {{ e2 }}% for {{ e3 }} seconds.

The damage and slow amount increase as the cask ferments, up to {{ e6 }}% after {{ e5 }} seconds. Deals {{ e7 }}% damage to minions.

q1.name: Barrel Roll
q1.blurb: Gragas rolls his cask to a location, which can be activated to explode or will explode on its own after 4 seconds. Enemies struck by the blast have their Movement Speed slowed.
q1.description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Gragas''' rolls a cask to the target location, granting {{tip|sight}} around it and fermenting over 2 seconds, increasing its [[damage]] and {{tip|slow}} strength, up to a maximum of 150%.
q1.description2: After 4 seconds or upon reactivation the cask {{ai|Barrel Roll 2|Gragas|explodes}}, dealing {{tip|magic damage|{{as|magic damage}}}} to all surrounding enemies, reduced by 30% against {{tip|minion|minions}}, and {{tip|slow|slowing}} them for 2 seconds.
q1.leveling: {{st|Non-Minion Magic Damage|{{ap|80 to 240}} {{as|(+ 70% AP)}}|Non-Minion Maximum Magic Damage|{{ap|80*1.5 to 240*1.5}} {{as|(+ 105% AP)}}|Minion Magic Damage|{{ap|80*0.7 to 240*0.7}} {{as|(+ 49% AP)}}|Minion Maximum Magic Damage|{{ap|80*1.5*0.7 to 240*1.5*0.7}} {{as|(+ {{fd|73.5}}% AP)}}}}{{st|Slow|{{ap|40 to 60}}%|Maximum Slow|{{ap|40*1.5 to 60*1.5}}%}}
notes: * The cask ignores unit and terrain collision therefore it will only stop once it reaches the target location.
** On arrival the cask will begin to glow ever brighter as it ferments until it turns bright red.
* ''Barrel Roll'' has an internal cooldown while traveling so that ''Gragas'' may only make it explode on arrival.
* The charge-up countdown will only start once the cask stops rolling.

riot.name: Barrel Roll
riot.description: Gragas rolls his cask to a location, which can be activated to explode or will explode on its own after 4 seconds. Enemies struck by the blast have their Movement Speed slowed.
riot.tooltip:
Gragas rolls his cask to a location. When reactivated, or after {{ e4 }} seconds, the cask will explode, dealing {{ e1 }} (+{{ a1 }}) magic damage to nearby enemies and slowing their movement speed by {{ e2 }}% for {{ e3 }} seconds.

The damage and slow amount increase as the cask ferments, up to {{ e6 }}% after {{ e5 }} seconds. Deals {{ e7 }}% damage to minions.

q2.blurb: Gragas rolls his cask to a location, which can be activated to explode or will explode on its own after 4 seconds. Enemies struck by the blast have their Movement Speed slowed.

q2.description2: After 4 seconds or upon reactivation the cask {{ai|Barrel Roll 2|Gragas|explodes}}, dealing {{tip|magic damage|{{as|magic damage}}}} to all surrounding enemies, reduced by 30% against {{tip|minion|minions}}, and {{tip|slow|slowing}} them for 2 seconds.
q2.leveling: {{st|Non-Minion Magic Damage|{{ap|80 to 240}} {{as|(+ 70% AP)}}|Non-Minion Maximum Magic Damage|{{ap|80*1.5 to 240*1.5}} {{as|(+ 105% AP)}}|Minion Magic Damage|{{ap|80*0.7 to 240*0.7}} {{as|(+ 49% AP)}}|Minion Maximum Magic Damage|{{ap|80*1.5*0.7 to 240*1.5*0.7}} {{as|(+ {{fd|73.5}}% AP)}}}}{{st|Slow|{{ap|40 to 60}}%|Maximum Slow|{{ap|40*1.5 to 60*1.5}}%}}
notes: * The cask ignores unit and terrain collision therefore it will only stop once it reaches the target location.
** On arrival the cask will begin to glow ever brighter as it ferments until it turns bright red.
* ''Barrel Roll'' has an internal cooldown while traveling so that ''Gragas'' may only make it explode on arrival.
* The charge-up countdown will only start once the cask stops rolling.

riot.name: Drunken Rage
riot.description: Gragas guzzles down brew from his cask for 1 second. After finishing, he becomes drunkenly empowered, dealing magic damage to all nearby enemies on his next basic attack and reducing damage received.
riot.tooltip:
Gragas guzzles down his brew, taking {{ e1 }}% (+{{ charabilitypower2*100 }}%) reduced damage for {{ e5 }} seconds.

After finishing his drink, his next basic attack deals magic damage to nearby enemies equal to {{ e3 }} (+{{ a1 }}) plus {{ e2 }}% of their max Health (max {{ e4 }} vs monsters).

w1.name: Drunken Rage
w1.blurb: Gragas guzzles down brew from his cask for 1 second. After finishing, he becomes drunkenly empowered, dealing magic damage to all nearby enemies on his next basic attack and reducing damage received.
w1.description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Gragas''' reduces incoming damage for {{fd|2.5}} seconds and {{ct|channel|channels|attack=false|cast=false|items=false,true|move=true|spells=true,true,false,false}} for {{fd|0.75}} seconds.
w1.description2: Upon completing the {{ai|Drunken Rage 2|Gragas|channel}}, '''Gragas'''' next basic attack within 5 seconds gains {{sti|range|50 '''bonus''' range}} and deals {{as|'''bonus''' magic damage}} to the target and nearby enemies, capped at 300 against {{tip|monsters}}.
w1.leveling2: {{st|Bonus Magic Damage|{{ap|20 to 140}} {{as|(+ 8% of target's '''maximum''' health)}} {{as|(+ 50% AP)}}|Maximum Damage to Monsters|{{ap|320 to 440}} {{as|(+ 50% AP)}}}}
notes: * The enhanced attack will apply other [[on-hit effect]]s and can {{tip|critical strike|critically strike}} as normal.

riot.name: Drunken Rage
riot.description: Gragas guzzles down brew from his cask for 1 second. After finishing, he becomes drunkenly empowered, dealing magic damage to all nearby enemies on his next basic attack and reducing damage received.
riot.tooltip:
Gragas guzzles down his brew, taking {{ e1 }}% (+{{ charabilitypower2*100 }}%) reduced damage for {{ e5 }} seconds.

After finishing his drink, his next basic attack deals magic damage to nearby enemies equal to {{ e3 }} (+{{ a1 }}) plus {{ e2 }}% of their max Health (max {{ e4 }} vs monsters).

w2.name: Drunken Rage
w2.blurb: Gragas guzzles down brew from his cask for 1 second. After finishing, he becomes drunkenly empowered, dealing magic damage to all nearby enemies on his next basic attack and reducing damage received.
w2.description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Gragas''' reduces incoming damage for {{fd|2.5}} seconds and {{ct|channel|channels|attack=false|cast=false|items=false,true|move=true|spells=true,true,false,false}} for {{fd|0.75}} seconds.
w2.description2: Upon completing the {{ai|Drunken Rage 2|Gragas|channel}}, '''Gragas'''' next basic attack within 5 seconds gains {{sti|range|50 '''bonus''' range}} and deals {{as|'''bonus''' magic damage}} to the target and nearby enemies, capped at 300 against {{tip|monsters}}.
w2.leveling2: {{st|Bonus Magic Damage|{{ap|20 to 140}} {{as|(+ 8% of target's '''maximum''' health)}} {{as|(+ 50% AP)}}|Maximum Damage to Monsters|{{ap|320 to 440}} {{as|(+ 50% AP)}}}}
notes: * The enhanced attack will apply other [[on-hit effect]]s and can {{tip|critical strike|critically strike}} as normal.

riot.name: Body Slam
riot.description: Gragas charges to a location and collides with the first enemy unit he comes across, dealing damage to all nearby enemy units and stunning them.
riot.tooltip:
Gragas charges forward, colliding with the first enemy unit. He deals {{ e1 }} (+{{ a1 }}) magic damage to enemies in the area and bumps them back, stunning them for {{ e2 }} second.

Body Slam's Cooldown is reduced by {{ f1 }} seconds if Gragas collides with a unit.

e1.name: Body Slam
e1.blurb: Gragas charges to a location and collides with the first enemy unit he comes across, dealing damage to all nearby enemy units and stunning them.
e1.description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Gragas''' {{tip|dash|charges}} forward, dealing {{as|magic damage}} to all nearby enemies upon colliding with one as well as {{tip|airborne|knocking them back}} and {{tip|stun|stunning}} them for 1 second.
e1.description2: ''Body Slam's'' {{sti|cooldown}} is reduced by 3 seconds if '''Gragas''' hits an enemy.
notes: * Units hit by ''Body Slam'' turn away from ''Gragas''.

riot.name: Explosive Cask
riot.description: Gragas hurls his cask to a location, dealing damage and knocking back enemies caught in the blast radius.
riot.tooltip: Gragas hurls his cask, causing it to explode when it lands. Enemies hit take {{ basedamage }} <scaleAP>(+{{ a1 }})</scaleAP> magic damage and are knocked away from the explosion.

r1.name: Explosive Cask
r1.blurb: Gragas hurls his cask to a location, dealing damage and knocking back enemies caught in the blast radius.
r1.description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Gragas''' hurls a cask for {{fd|0.55}} seconds to the target location exploding on impact, {{as|damaging|magic damage}} all nearby enemies and {{tip|airborne|knocking them back}} 900 units from the epicenter of the explosion, while also briefly granting {{tip|sight}} of the nearby surroundings.
